intro: Hexadesmia brachyphylla var. longior, commonly known as the long-stemmed hexadesmia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, shaded environments.
